place.name: CARLETON ST PETER
place.gazetteerText: CARLETON-ST. PETER, a parish in Loddon district, Norfolk; near the river Yare; 3 miles NNW of Loddon, and 3½ SW by S of Buckenham r. station. Post Town, Loddon, under Norwich. Acres, 772. Real property, £1,159. Pop., 79. Houses, 18. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory, united with the rectory of Ashby, in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £294. Patrons, Sir W. B. Proctor and SirH. Rich, Barts. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
